medical_history.chief_complaint: Crampy lower abdominal pains for several days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain was acute in onset over a 1 day period, described as 'crampy'. The patient denied any associated fevers, chills, nausea, emesis, or pain with urination.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary Artery Disease, prior STEMI, PCI/stenting to RCA, history of Acute Myelogenous Leukemia, chemotherapy, radiation, and bone marrow transplantation, hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, GERD, diet-controlled Type II Diabetes Mellitus, diverticulosis, occasional bronchospasm, history of SVC clot, history of C.Difficile, history of VRE, history of shingles, history of asthma.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with a history of stroke. Both maternal and paternal grandmothers had a history of CVA. Father with history of colon cancer. No known blood disorders. Sister with hypertension.
